item.title: 01. Setup
item.description:
Professor Tizzik has made a huge breakthrough in their research and is looking for spelljammers to test out an experimental vessel. A call has been sent out to the citizens of Revon to recruit brave souls to embark on an incredible adventure to far away worlds. Characters must have the Spell-casting ability to qualify, (Barbarian, Fighter, or Rogue characters must take a subclass to participate) and no Spelljamming experience is required! Volunteers will be paid 100gp after 4 weeks of participation. All participants in this study will be required to live at the research facility and all meals will be provided.
The very first Grasshopper Ship was test piloted by Timmon Fizbang (assistant to Professor Tizzik). These early test flights were largely terrestrial. Using this rudimentary version, Timmon was able to successfully travel from Palicona to Duultha to retrieve a message for Professor Tizzik which took roughly a 6 hours to complete the round trip, a sea ship would have take a full day just to make one leg of this journey. After this incredibly achievement, the next test flight was to attempt to reach the moon around Maa. Upon exiting the atmosphere, a Squid ship attacked, since the pilot's concentration was occupied by the spelljamming helm, Timmon wasn't able to cast any spells or control the Auto Bolt Cannon to provide any resistance. The squid ship closed in quickly but Timmon was able to cast dimension door before the attack was able to land a final blow.
Professor Tizzik now having some credible and compelling evidence that spelljamming can be made more accessible by shrinking the size of the vessels, went in search of funding to build a second generation of ships. Viceroy Florian Ott was quite impressed with the potential and offered to invest in the research. The manufacture of 5 new ships took the better part of a year, and now the professor is looking for new test pilots, Timmon is understandably rattled by their encounter with the squid ship.
Many folks have attended the informational sessions but so far no one has signed up after learning of the risks. The investment made by Viceroy Florian Ott was with public funds provided by the Council of Stewards's Committee for Innovation in Magic (CIM) and the report for effectiveness of the investment is coming due, which has caused the Viceroy to put some extra pressure on the Professor to find some damn pilots.
Timmon Fizbang has recently been able to bottle a batch of a tonic that operates similar to the spell Revivify but to avoid the expense of a 300gp diamond, they used a much less rare gem and as a result the revivified person is always reset back to level 1. With this batch of tonic, the team has reached an agreement with the morgue of Duultha to feed this tonic to those who have died a heroic death. They have requested only those who have some kind of spellcasting ability to serve as the test pilots.
To address the need for the pilot to be concentrating on steering the spelljamming helm, Professor Tizzik has purchased the materials required to create a handful of Circlets of Concentration to attach to the helm of each Grasshopper Ship. Unfortunately, the materials were stolen in transit.

item.title: Circlet of Concentration
item.description: A device that floats a foot above the head of an attuned player which is capable to dividing the "wearer"'s concentration. The device itself is bound to another magical object that requires concentration to control. Once bound the only ways to break that bond would result in the destruction of the Circlet.

item.title: Auto Bolt Cannon
item.description: Effectively a miniature mechanized ballista that can be controlled by a system of leavers no more than 50 feet from the device. The device requires 1 character to take the Aim action but have a maximum of 5 bolts loaded at a time. A new magazine can be loaded with an Action.For personal spelljamming craft, one of these can be mounted on the deck and the controls can be routed to the spelljamming helm on the ship.The magazine auto-loads each of the 5 bolts so the operator doesn't need to take the Load action unless the magazine has run out. Each time a bolt has been fired, the Aim action must be taken before it can be fired again. Aiming and firing required pulling a series of leavers in the correct order. If a player has a Wisdom, Strength, Dexterity, or Intelligence of less than 10, the character must roll a DC 10 ability check (the player can choose any of the above 4 abilities) with proficiency. On a failed save the Aim action has failed, if the character chooses to Aim again on their next turn, it will automatically be successful; if the character chooses any other action it the a new roll is required.

item.title: Timmon Fizbang
Timmon Fizzbang
Revon
item.description:
An nation comprised of 125 island archipelago. Historically the islands subsided mostly on fish and trade resources from the sea like fish, pearls, ambergris, etc.The native people of these islands are a drow tribe called the Vontal. The Vontal were a small and sparse population, most homes have a shrine to both Oghma, god of knowledge and Gond, god of craft; inventors are the most revered of their population.
The first group of spelljammers to visit the wildspace were the crew of The Revenant who were hunting Astroid spiders. They found a particularly large one in the wildspace system Aurinkokunta. In the process of killing their found target the ship was badly damage. The crew managed to safely land the ship with their carcass in tow on the planet Maa among a chain of sparsely populated islands. The Vontal banded together to save the lives of the crew and in return the Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel offered to split carcass. Wallace Cartwright saw an opportunity in the deal proposed by Twice, the knowledge of spelljamming and new resource materials in the carcass would be a potent combination; he was right. The signing of the Accords of Revon, established a new nation on the planet Maa as a union between the 25 Giff crew of the Revenant and the 100 or so Vontal.Quickly with the astral knowledge and resources of the Giff combined with the curiosity and craft of the Vontal resulted in a whole trade in semi-magical devices consisting of spelljammer ships, personal water craft and low atmosphere air ships.
Recently an ancient Thri-kreen Professor Tizzik setup a new laboratory with the blessing of the united Revon government and significant investment from the Viceroy Florian Ott the leader of the city-state of Palicona.

item.title: Wallace Cartwright
item.description: Leader of the Vontal when Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel and The Revenant arrived on Maa.

item.title: Grasshopper Ship
item.description: A spelljamming ship that can be piloted by a crew of 1 spell caster and hosts an air envelope that could sustain 2 medium sized creatures for 12 hours or 1 for 24 hours. These ships are capable of traveling between worlds in the same Wildspace system Attempting to reach the astral sea would likely result in the loss of the pilot and ship due to the distance needed. Even if the ship was able to make it to the sea, exiting would be even more dangerous without any oxygen.Fly speed: 100ft (24mph), minimum of 50 feet of movement if move action is taken.So far, the testing has largely been on-world travel since the first attempt to travel off planet resulted in the ship being destroyed by a Squid Ship, the test pilot Timmon Fizbang was just fast enough to drop their concentration and trigger a dimension door to return to the laboratory.

item.title: Professor Tizzik
Professor Tizzik
item.description:
The Professor has spent hundreds of years in/on the astral sea researching the magic that enables Spelljamming and the people who choose to use Spelljamming to travel across the astral plane.They have recently setup shop on a planet in the Wildspace system named Aurinkokunta on a planet called Maa. The laboratory they've setup in the nation of Revon in the city of Palicona to study the interaction between pocket dimensions and the mass of an object. Their target is to attempt to create larger air envelopes for Spelljamming ships without requiring such large crews.
They recently made a breakthrough in creating a bag of holding that seems to add mass to the holder but the weight of the bag is unchanged. This has lead to the development of Grasshopper Ships which are spelljamming ships that can be piloted by a crew as low as 1 caster in the helm.

item.title: 99. Random Thoughts
item.description: Barbarians in the fey wild work like bees for fire crop farmers (fire wheat, fire plums?)Characters are resurrected failed hero’s (cadavers at a medical college)?Dungeon Built beneath or on top of a mesa or several connected mesas — planet for western themed bounty?One nation has created a large number of very powerful magic items with seemingly permanent effect at a scale that seems far too high. (sweat shops? Warforged? Hadozee? Giff?) this has lead to some surprisingly futuristic magic/tech. Floating carriages pulled by an animated object that mentally connects with a caster who is attuned to it (similar to a spelljamming helm) it is controlled by that caster.A bounty in neo-Tokyo-esque city state. Faerie fire lit floating carriages zoom over monsoon wet roads, (no one seems to care about controlling the weather). A dark and dreary city, it is artificially darkened by spell work to accommodate the drow ruling class, very few drow here worship lloth, mostly worshiping Shar goddess of the night or Selene goddess of the moon . The first mission is to get back stolen Circlet of Concentration materials to enable interplanetary travel

item.title: Council of Stewards
item.description: The international governing body, originally established as a regular meeting of the monarchal leaders of each nation of Maa. When the last King of Kettu died suddenly, the contentions war of succession lasted for nearly a decade, the entire nation was torn apart. When all parties coffers and populations were exhausted to the point of disaster a treaty was finally negotiated in a pure stalemate. The terms of the treaty took another year to finalize due to no clear heir to the throne, instead each of the lordly houses elected an independent Steward. At the passing of each monarchal leader on the planet Maa, instead of attempting succession, each nation instead negotiated a similar treaty as Kettu. At this point there are no true monarch's on Maa, only representatives elected by their regional leaders.The council meets 4 times each year, to decide international affairs. This body determines rules for enforcing safety when navigating the seas of Maa as well as the regulations that enable or impede trade between nations.
